snippet: With his political isolation deepening, President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt demanded late Tuesday that the military rescind its ultimatum against him.
abstract: Pres Mohamed Morsi, responding to threat from Egypt's generals giving him 48 hours to meet protesters' demands or face military rule, rejects ultimatum in angry speech; insists that he is the legitimate leader of the country, and hints that any effort to remove him by force could plunge the nation into further chaos.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With his political isolation deepening, President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt demanded late Tuesday that the military rescind its ultimatum against him.

headline.main:
Morsi Defies
Egypt Army’s
Ultimatum to
Bend to Protest
headline.print_headline: Egyptian President Defies Military Ultimatum to Step Down

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
